comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: A good likeness to a photograph of Captain Sir Edward Simons Ward, 2nd Bt. b. 1 July 1882, d. 21 July 1930 on thepeerage.com/p27706.htm "Captain Sir Edward Simons Ward, 2nd Bt. was born on 1 July 1882. He was the son of Florence Caroline Simons. He died on 21 July 1930 at age 48, unmarried, in a flying accident. He was educated at Eton College, Windsor, Berkshire, England. He gained the rank of Captain in the service of the Grenadier Guards. He fought in the First World War, where he was wounded. He gained the title of 2nd Baronet Ward [U.K., 1914] in 1928. He lived in 1930 at Berkeley House, Hay Hill, London, England." Died in Meopham Air Disaster kenttodayandyesterday.blogspot.com/2010_07_01_archive.html Son of Colonel Sir Edward Willis Duncan Ward, 1st Baronet, of Wilbraham Place (1853–1928) and Florence Caroline Simons (1858–1934) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sir_Edward_Ward,_1st_Baronet,_of_Wi...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Note a different birth year 1888 and fact he was married and divorced - noted in the ebook by Arthur Charles Fox-Davies 'Armorial families : a directory of gentlemen of coat-armour (Volume 2)' www.ebooksread.com/authors-eng/arthur-charles-fox-davies/... Sons of Sir Edward Willis Duncan Ward, 1st Bart G.B.E., K.C.B., K.C.V.O., of Wilbraham Place, Chelsea, Col. (ret.) Army Service Corps, J. P. co. London, b. 1853 ; d. 1928 ; m. 1880, Florence Caroline, d. of the late Henry Minchin Simons, of 72 Courtfield Gardens, S.W.:— Sir Edward Simons Ward, 2nd Bart. (20 Jan. 1914), [Supporters— (May 29, 1919) On either side a mastiff guard- ant proper, gorged with a collar paly argent and azure, being the armlet of the Metropolitan Special Constabulary] Capt. Grenadier Guards (Special Reserve), served in European War 1914 (wounded), b. 1888 m. 1908, Lois (who obtained a divorce in 1916), second d. of H. W. Jefferson, of Stoke Rocheford, Grantham. Res. — Berkeley House Hay Hill, W.i. Clubs— White's, Orleans. Melvill Willis Ward, Esq., D.S.C., Comdr. Emergency List R.N., b. 1885; tn. 1907, Alice Sophia, d. of the late William Cobbett, J. P. Res. — Coombe Meadows, Ascot. Club — Bachel ors' .
